  "description": "Rifugio Communications Limited is a registered partner to Samsung and other global mobile device brands in Nigeria. We operate a chain of Samsung Experience Stores and Rifugio Brand stores, which provide an array of warranty protected Mobile devices and accessories at the best prices, across Nigeria. We offer mobile hardware required to house bespoke Sales Force Automation and Mobile Device Management solutions (Samsung Knox) to organizations. We offer Laptops, printers (inclusive of mobile and portable printers), printing consumables such as ink and toners, as well as other types of IT equipment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chartered Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Functional Area:&nbsp;&nbsp;Finance
Reports to:&nbsp;Finance Manager

Overall Purpose of Job


	Provide support to the finance function in managing the day-to-day financial activities of the company.
	Responsible for assisting in the management of the Finance Function.


Responsibilities


	Everyday book keeping.
	Processing of invoices and ensuring each expense is cross-checked with the corresponding invoice.
	Documentation/recording of payments.
	Tracking payables and receivables.
	Maintaining the imprest system.
	Inventory Management.
	Petty cash/expense management.
	Bank transactions/reconciliations.
	Daily Bank Pos Reconciliations.
	Processing refunds and resolving billing disputes.
	Ensure prompt invoicing and debt collection.
	Support in the compilation, analysis and approval of global monthly budgets for management consideration.
	Support in Prepare financial statements.
	Comply with internal control procedures on a day to day basis.
	Support and review day to day work of the finance unit.
	Participates in the selection of subordinate members of the Finance team.
	Support in Payroll Administration.
	Support in PAYE and administration of other taxes and statutory payments.
	Carry out any other tasks assigned by the Finance Manager.


Person Specifications / Competencies


	First Degree in Accounting or related courses.
	2 &ndash; 5 years of cognate experience.
	ICAN / ACA Certification is required.
	Experience in retail business is an added advantage.
	Sound knowledge of accounting standards.
	Proficiency in the use of computer applications.
	Proficiency in the use of Quickbooks is an added advantage.
	Sound numeric skills.
	Sound MS Excel skill.
	Good knowledge of import finance operations.
	Relationship management.
	Problem solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent oral and written communication skills.
	Interpersonal skills.
	Personal organization.
	Experience in Retail Organization.


Method of Application&nbsp;

We offer Laptops, printers (inclusive of mobile and portable printers), printing consumables such as ink and toners, as well as other types of IT equipment.

Job Position: Chartered Accountant
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Functional Area:  Finance
Reports to: Finance Manager

Overall Purpose of Job


	Provide support to the finance function in managing the day-to-day financial activities of the company.
	Responsible for assisting in the management of the Finance Function.


Responsibilities


	Everyday book keeping.
	Processing of invoices and ensuring each expense is cross-checked with the corresponding invoice.
	Documentation/recording of payments.
	Tracking payables and receivables.
	Maintaining the imprest system.
	Inventory Management.
	Petty cash/expense management.
	Bank transactions/reconciliations.
	Daily Bank Pos Reconciliations.
	Processing refunds and resolving billing disputes.
	Ensure prompt invoicing and debt collection.
	Support in the compilation, analysis and approval of global monthly budgets for management consideration.
	Support in Prepare financial statements.
	Comply with internal control procedures on a day to day basis.
	Support and review day to day work of the finance unit.
	Participates in the selection of subordinate members of the Finance team.
	Support in Payroll Administration.
	Support in PAYE and administration of other taxes and statutory payments.
	Carry out any other tasks assigned by the Finance Manager.


Person Specifications / Competencies


	First Degree in Accounting or related courses.
	2 – 5 years of cognate experience.
	ICAN / ACA Certification is required.
	Experience in retail business is an added advantage.
	Sound knowledge of accounting standards.
	Proficiency in the use of computer applications.
	Proficiency in the use of Quickbooks is an added advantage.
	Sound numeric skills.
	Sound MS Excel skill.
	Good knowledge of import finance operations.
	Relationship management.
	Problem solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent oral and written communication skills.
	Interpersonal skills.
	Personal organization.
	Experience in Retail Organization.

General / Business Development Manager Job at Flavours Master Restaurant




        
    

        
        Flavours Master Restaurant is a vibrant and rapidly expanding restaurant brand, distinguished as a true culinary destination. We pride ourselves on offering an unparalleled dining experience, featuring a meticulously crafted menu that journeys from the sophisticated tastes ofcontinental cuisineto the rich, authentic flavours of Africana dishes, complemented by an array of delightful snacks. Our commitment extends beyond the plate; we are dedicated to fostering a culture of operational excellence, continuous innovation, and outstanding customer satisfaction. Joining Flavours Master means becoming part of a passionate team poised for significant growth and impact in the dynamic hospitality sector.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General / Business Development Manager
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Are you an exceptional leader with a passion for the culinary world and a proven track record of driving operational excellence?
	You will be the strategic backbone of our restaurant, responsible for optimizing day-to-day operations, business development, enhancing customer experience, and ensuring efficient execution across all departments.
	You will work closely with the CEO to translate our vision into actionable plans and drive sustainable growth.


Key Responsibilities
Business Development for Increased Profitability:


	Operational Leadership: Oversee and optimize all aspects of restaurant operations, including kitchen management, front-of-house service, supply chain, inventory, and facility management.
	Strategic Execution: Translate the CEO's vision and business strategies into clear operational goals and ensure their effective implementation across all levels.
	Financial Performance: Manage budgets, control costs, analyze financial data, and identify opportunities to improve profitability and efficiency.
	Team Development & Management: Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team, fostering a culture of excellence, accountability, and continuous improvement.
	Quality & Standards: Implement and enforce rigorous quality control measures for food preparation, service delivery, and hygiene, ensuring an unparalleled dining experience.
	Customer Experience: Champion initiatives to enhance customer satisfaction, build loyalty, and effectively resolve any operational challenges that may arise.
	Growth & Expansion: Play a key role in identifying opportunities for growth, streamlining processes for scalability, and supporting future expansion plans.
	Compliance: Ensure strict adherence to all health, safety, and regulatory standards.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or a related field; MBA is a significant advantage.
	Proven experience (minimum of 7 - 10 years) in a senior operational leadership role within the hospitality or restaurant industry, ideally with multi-unit management experience.
	Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.
	Demonstrated ability to drive operational efficiency, implement best practices, and improve performance metrics.
	Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, even under pressure.
	Proficiency in restaurant management software and POS systems.
	A deep understanding of the Nigerian culinary landscape and customer preferences is a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: susaneze5@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Location: Lagos

	The Chief Operating Officer will provide day-to-day leadership and management in all areas of the company’s business operations (including sales, marketing, human resources, IT, administration, &operations).

	Other duties as assigned by the board or the Managing Director.


Required Experience

  "description": "Mitera Health Limited (RC 1190295) is a technology-driven healthcare organization. We provide flexible, affordable and accessible health insurance plans to meet the needs of Nigerians with guaranteed access to qualitative healthcare.

Summary


	The Underwriter at Mitera Health HMO is responsible for assessing the risk associated with potential and existing members, determining appropriate premium rates, and establishing policy terms and conditions for health insurance plans.
	This role requires keen analytical skills, attention to detail, and a thorough understanding of health risk factors and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Evaluate individual and group health applications to assess risks and determine eligibility for health insurance coverage.
	Analyze medical histories, demographics, lifestyle factors, and other relevant data to quantify risk.
	Determine appropriate premium rates and policy terms based on risk assessment guidelines and actuarial data.
	Review Electronic Discharge Summaries (EDS) and other health records to inform underwriting decisions.
	Collaborate with sales, actuarial, and claims departments to ensure competitive pricing and sound risk management.
	Ensure all underwriting decisions comply with internal policies, industry regulations, and legal requirements.
	Prepare detailed reports of underwriting activities, including Utilization reports
	Assist in the development and refinement of underwriting guidelines and processes.
	Respond to inquiries from agents, brokers, and internal teams regarding underwriting decisions and guidelines.
	Monitor industry trends and regulatory changes impacting health insurance underwriting.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, or a related analytical field.
	Proven experience (3-5 years) as an Underwriter in the health insurance or HMO sector is essential.
	Strong analytical, critical thinking, and decision-making skills.
	Excellent understanding of medical terminology, health conditions, and their impact on risk.
	Proficiency in data analysis tools and software.
	Knowledge of health insurance laws, regulations, and industry best practices.
	Strong communication skills to articulate complex risk assessments and decisions.
	Ability to work accurately under pressure and meet deadlines


Method of Application

Underwriting Officer Job at Mitera Health Limited




        
    

        
        Mitera Health Limited (RC 1190295) is a technology-driven healthcare organization. We provide flexible, affordable and accessible health insurance plans to meet the needs of Nigerians with guaranteed access to qualitative healthcare.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Underwriting Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	The Underwriter at Mitera Health HMO is responsible for assessing the risk associated with potential and existing members, determining appropriate premium rates, and establishing policy terms and conditions for health insurance plans.
	This role requires keen analytical skills, attention to detail, and a thorough understanding of health risk factors and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Evaluate individual and group health applications to assess risks and determine eligibility for health insurance coverage.
	Analyze medical histories, demographics, lifestyle factors, and other relevant data to quantify risk.
	Determine appropriate premium rates and policy terms based on risk assessment guidelines and actuarial data.
	Review Electronic Discharge Summaries (EDS) and other health records to inform underwriting decisions.
	Collaborate with sales, actuarial, and claims departments to ensure competitive pricing and sound risk management.
	Ensure all underwriting decisions comply with internal policies, industry regulations, and legal requirements.
	Prepare detailed reports of underwriting activities, including Utilization reports
	Assist in the development and refinement of underwriting guidelines and processes.
	Respond to inquiries from agents, brokers, and internal teams regarding underwriting decisions and guidelines.
	Monitor industry trends and regulatory changes impacting health insurance underwriting.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Finance, Mathematics, or a related analytical field.
	Proven experience (3-5 years) as an Underwriter in the health insurance or HMO sector is essential.
	Strong analytical, critical thinking, and decision-making skills.
	Excellent understanding of medical terminology, health conditions, and their impact on risk.
	Proficiency in data analysis tools and software.
	Knowledge of health insurance laws, regulations, and industry best practices.
	Strong communication skills to articulate complex risk assessments and decisions.
	Ability to work accurately under pressure and meet deadlines


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application and Cover letter to: joboffer@miterahealth.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
